Photo courtesy of ARKANE ALEWORKS Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save LARGO ‚Äî Arkane Aleworks captured the 2019 Best Small Brewery in Florida at the annual Best Florida Beer Championship in Tampa on March 3. The Largo brewery was awarded four medals for their beers, and this is the second consecutive year that Arkane has received the award after winning three gold medals in 2018. Arkane also earned the title of third best brewery overall at Cigar City Brewing's Hunahpu's Day. AchieveHERs to host Women Sharing Wisdom luncheon, panel discussion DUNEDIN ‚Äî¬†AchieveHERs, the business women‚Äôs networking group of the Clearwater Regional Chamber of Commerce, will host the next event in its Women Sharing Wisdom luncheon series Thursday, March 28, 11 a.m. to 1 p.m., at Bon Appetit Restaurant, 148 Marina Plaza, Dunedin. ‚ÄúLife Cycle Part II: Women and Transitions, That Was Then, This Is Now,‚Äù a panel presentation, is the second part of a series that digs deep into the issues that affect women in their professional and personal lives. Four dynamic women, at very different points in their journeys, will share perspectives and retrospectives on how they juggle priorities among self, career, home and that elusive state called ‚Äúlife balance.‚Äù When the path got tough, each called upon her concrete will to summon the courage to succeed. Panelists will include Christina Capri, vice president of commercial banking, Synovus; Ashley Lowery, president and CEO, Homeless Empowerment Program; Kathy Rabon, CFRE, CFRM, executive director, Suncoast Hospice Foundation; and Anna Leo Holder, MBA, vice president of Client Services, Frank Crum. Cost is $50 for members and $55 for nonmembers. To register, visit clearwaterflorida.org/achievehers . For information, email mreddington@clearwaterflorida.org or call 727-461-0011, ext. 229. LocalShops1 to present St. Pete Tiny Home Festival ST. PETERSBURG ‚Äî LocalShops1‚Äôs second annual St. Pete Tiny Home Festival will be presented Saturday and Sunday, March 23-24, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m., at St. Petersburg College‚Äôs Allstate Center, 3200 34th St. S., St. Petersburg. For event information, visit www.tinyhomestpete.com . The festival will showcase model homes by professional builders, custom-made homes, ‚Äúskoolies‚Äù and van conversions built by talented enthusiasts who travel the country showing off their creations. Altogether, more than 30 tiny structures and 50 local food trucks, mobile boutiques, artists, home-related businesses and restaurants are expected at the festival. In just its second year it has grown to be the largest tiny home festival anywhere on the U.S. Gulf Coast and second largest in the entire state of Florida. A special event feature is a lineup of two dozen leading experts in the tiny house movement giving practical advice on living green, decluttering your current residence and building your very own tiny home. Additional features include an environmentally conscious water station by Chart 411 and a wine and beer garden by the Skyway Marina District. The festival is a production of LocalShops1, and sponsored by Skyway Marina District, Chart 411, Historic Shed, Tiny House Advisor and Leaf Filter. Event tickets and marketing opportunities are available. Visit www.tinyhomestpete.com or email ester@localshops1.com for information. Robin Miller joins Creative Pinellas board of directors ST. PETE BEACH ‚Äî Robin Miller, president and CEO of the Tampa Bay Beaches Chamber of Commerce, recently was appointed to the 2019 board of directors for Creative Pinellas. Creative Pinellas, a nonprofit local arts agency, holds a mission to sustain the creative communities that make Pinellas County a great place to live and experience culture. Miller has 11 years of experience with Pinellas County businesses. She brings with her the strong ability to build and grow organizations from the ground up. At the chamber, part of her job is to lead entire operations for financials, management, PR, sales, marketing, events, and government relations. For information, email Jessica Morrow at jessica@tampabaybeaches.com or visit TampaBayBeaches.com . Manager becomes owner of Clearwater auto repair shop CLEARWATER ‚Äî Ice Cold Air Discount Auto Repair recently named Dennis McBride as the new franchise owner at the Clearwater location on Court Street. McBride has served as manager of several Pinellas County Ice Cold Air locations in the 10 years he has worked for the company. He has over 25 years of experience in the automotive industry. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been thinking about becoming an owner for a while now,‚Äù McBride said in a press release. ‚ÄúI just wanted it to be the right shop. I think this is one of the best locations in the company. It is certainly one with the longest history of serving our loyal customers.‚Äù The location has been an Ice Cold Air since the 1970s. American Freedom Distillery to take part in D-Day celebration ST. PETERSBURG ‚Äî American Freedom Distillery, a St. Petersburg-based craft distillery of American-made premium spirits, was recently invited to the celebration of the 75th anniversary of D-Day and the Battle of Normandy. Team American Freedom, as the brand has named themselves for the event, will parachute into the historic drop zones of Normandy, along with an airdropped barrel of Horse Soldier Bourbon. The official D-Day anniversary jump will take place June 5. Team American Freedom will be the lead aircraft during the airborne operations on June 5, making them among the first to land in the drop zone locations. To prepare, the team is holding practice parachute jumps in North Florida in the town of Palatka using the historic C-47 Tico Belle, the same plane that dropped the brave men into Normandy 75 years ago. The first practice jump will be held in March. ‚ÄúOur brand was founded by a team of former Special Forces members, so it‚Äôs an incredible honor to be invited to this celebration as a brand, but also as veterans and represent our country and brethren of past, present,‚Äù said Scott Neil, co-founder and former Green Beret. ‚ÄúThis is a unique, once in a lifetime opportunity for us and it‚Äôs incredible to not only be invited to participate in the 75th anniversary, but to be the lead aircraft for the reenactment of airborne celebrations.‚Äù Fastow, Drake join Bizco Technologies CLEARWATER ‚Äî Bizco Technologies recently welcomed Brandon Fastow, systems engineer; and Charles Drake, remote systems engineer, to the Clearwater team. Fastow and Drake bring over 20 combined years of experience in managed IT services. ‚ÄúI am excited to have the opportunity to join this dynamic and growing company and team,‚Äù said Drake. ‚ÄúI am looking forward to develop and maintain successful relationships with our all our clients that will streamline, secure, and improve their overall internal efficiency,‚Äù Fastow added. Bizco‚Äôs engineering team provides local clients with advanced network management and security solutions. This gives each client the ability to promptly address technical concerns remotely, or on-site. To submit business news, email editorial@TBNweekly.com . Submissions also may be faxed to 727-397-5900, dropped off at the office or mailed to Tampa Bay Newspapers, 9911 Seminole Blvd., Seminole, FL 33772. Please include contact information on all submissions. 		Navigation Toggle high contrast Request a Therapy Dogs Visit¬†‚Æï Open to students, faculty and staff. Become a PAWS Event Volunteer ‚Æï Open to students, faculty, and staff. Become a PAWS Lead Volunteer ‚Æï Open to students, faculty, and staff, who have previously volunteered with us at least 3 times. Join the PAWS Therapy Dog Team ‚Æï Open to handlers and their dogs. BGSU PAWS Team BGSU Recreation and Wellness Student Wellness PAWS Therapy Dog Team The BGSU PAWS Team is a dedicated group of campus and community volunteers and certified therapy dogs. The team hosts events on BGSU campuses throughout the year and is also available by request. This program is part of the Office of Health & Wellness at BGSU and offers programing to support the BGSU community in all aspects of well-being. View our WBGU The Journal episode for an in-depth overview of the organization along with a few of our dogs and humans! Positive impacts of animal therapy: Reduced stress and anxiety Decreased¬†feelings of loneliness, pain and fatigue Increased feelings of safety Decreased risk for cardiovascular disease Increased physical exercise PAWS stands for P artners in A chieving W ellness for S tudents, staff and faculty. All PAWS dogs are certified by the Alliance of Therapy Dogs . Certified therapy dogs must be friendly, patient, confident, gentle and at ease in all situations. PAWS Team Events Student Wellness Presentations Wellness Ambassadors Well-Being Programs PAWS Therapy Dog Team Mental Well-Being Sexual and Reproductive Health Access Information Sexual Health Sexual Health Education and HIV/STI Testing Alcohol Education Green Dot Cargo Bike Special Events Student Wellness Network Spring Break Checklist Sexual Assault Awareness Month 5K and Dog Walk Stall Talk Clean Air Policy Resources Safe Communities of Wood County Contact Us 214 Student Recreation Center 1411 Ridge Street Bowling Green, OH 43403 Phone: 419.372.9355 (WELL) Fax: 419.372.9454 wellness@bgsu.edu Attention BGSU Students ‚ûî Friends of the BGSU PAWS Team is a student-led organization made up by our Lead Volunteers. We meet once a month and focus on assisting the therapy dogs and their owners who visit campus, student volunteers, and campus partners. As a PAWS Lead Volunteer you get the opportunity to help staff events, run our social media accounts, and fundraise for the program. This is an integral role within the program which helps us improve the wellness of the BGSU community through our therapy dog program. Meet the Therapy Dogs Archie Breed: Portuguese Water Dog Birthdate: 9/16/2020 Family: Ron Z. Major: Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (D.V.M.) Clinical specialty, Residency in Neurological Conditioning & Training of my handler. Wellness Practices: Going for daily walks or runs with an occasional swim. I stick to a well-balanced diet and have 3 meals a day. Fun Fact: My breed was originally developed in the 1930s by Dr. Bensaude in Portugal. I only respond to Portuguese commands. Barli Breed: Bernedoodle Birthdate: 7/31/2021 Family: Jeffrey Major: Master of Science in Nutrition (Bulking) Wellness Practices: Relaxing! He loves to take naps with dad. Fun Fact: Barli weighs 146 lbs. Bella Breed: Australian Shepard Birthdate: 3/18/2021 Family: Krista H. Classroom Hero Award Winner PAWS Team Advisory Group Member Profiles Jean Kitchen and Sochi received the Classroom Hero of the Month Award from BCAN/BCSN ! Congratulations to our own, Jean and Sochi for receiving the Buckeye Community Arts Network/Buckey Cable Sports Network Classroom Hero of the Month Award for November!¬†We are so proud to have this amazing team as part of BGSU PAWS! Thank you for all you do, Jean & Sochi. Learn more about their award on the BSCN Classroom Heroes Website . Lex Blanton I grew up in the dog industry apprenticing under various nationally recognized trainers and participating in AKC & UKC junior handling events since early childhood. I have been competitive in dog shows for 15 years, putting numerous show & sport titles on both my dogs and client dogs. I have been employed as a professional trainer for 9 years, working with good manners clients, service dogs, therapy dogs, detection dogs, aggression cases, and more. I am a Certified Professional Dog Trainer - Knowledge & Skills Assessed through the CCPDT, a Zoom Room Certified Master Trainer, an IAABC behavior consultant, a Fear Free Certified Animal Trainer, a certified AKC Family Dog Evaluator, an ATD Therapy Dog Tester/Observer, and an active member of the Pet Professional Guild. At Zoom Room, we don't train dogs, we train the people who love them! We offer AKC S.T.A.R. Puppy, Obedience, Rally, Agility, Scent Work, Urban Herding, Flyball, Therapy Dog, Tricks, and Canine Conditioning classes in Perrysburg, OH. Zoom Room dog training classes are specially designed to encourage dogs to build confidence and success as they master new behaviors in a simple, step-by-step process. Our classes have skills-based graduation requirements to keep learning at your own pace. Every class is also offered multiple times each week so you can come as many or as few times as you want each week for additional instruction and practice. Cheryl Kubista I am the owner and Master trainer here at Talk Dog Toledo, LLC training facility.¬† I have been training dogs for the last 18 years here in the Toledo, OH area.¬† After completing a 4-week intense training program, I opened my own training company 2005. I have completed additional training over the years to further my skills.¬† I work with dogs of all ages, all breeds and all types of issues.¬† I offer private lessons, group classes and board and train options for clients. My group classes start with puppy kindergarten and go all the way up to therapy dog and service dog skills.¬† I work with my clients to make sure that they can achieve their dog training goals! I am also an AKC and CGC evaluator, an Alliance of Therapy Dogs tester and observer and a field rep for Paws with a Cause. I am a professional member of the IACP as well as the APDT. In Loving Memory Murphy , bichon frise, served as a therapy dog for over 17 years. In addition to supporting the BGSU community, Murphy also visited libraries, hospitals, nursing homes, and many other locations in the community. ~March 2005 ‚Äì October 2023 Faith , a miniature American Shepard, was an amazing dog who loved spreading joy to others. She was born March 17th, 2013. Faith served as a medical service dog for 8 years prior to becoming a therapy dog. She knew over 130 commands and could read a command on a paper and then do the command. ~March 2013-April 2022 Brady was known around campus for his love of belly rubs. Brady loved to swim and go duck hunting. Brady had 7 titles including AKC Canine Good Citizenship Advanced. He started as a therapy dog in 2015 and did nearly 1000 visits. ~03/01/2012 ‚Äì 05/16/2022 Updated: 08/05/2025 02:01PM Bowling Green State University Bowling Green, Ohio 43403-0001 419-372-2531 Make A Gift Accessibility including events Academics A-Z Links Campus Directory Consumer Information Employment Faculty/Staff Firelands Libraries Media Resources Nondiscrimination Parents and Families Students Technology Support Title IX Resources Toggle High Contrast SEE IT. The App About the App Participating Cities Frequently Asked Questions Download on the App Store Download on Google Play Gift a Subscription Merch PubPass Deer Shirt PubPass Tank Top PubPass Woman's Tank Top PubPass Bottle Opener PubPass Ceramic Mug PubPass Silicone Pint Glass PubPass Collapsable Dog Dish PubPass Sun Glasses PubPass Embroidered Deer Hat Now reading: Q&A WITH PINELLAS ALE WORKS Share Prev Next February 24, 2021 Q&A WITH PINELLAS ALE WORKS When it comes to award-winning beers¬†and a die-hard love for dogs, it is hard to find a place that does it better than Pinellas Ale Works (PAW). As its initials would suggest, PAW is one of the most dog-friendly breweries in St. Pete with a dual mission of brewing doggone good beer and giving back to the community by hosting weekly and monthly events benefiting Pinellas County animal related charities. Read¬†more on¬†their taproom,¬†beers and events on their website . Q. WHAT'S YOUR NAME? A.¬†Michelle Appleyard Q. WHAT IS YOUR TITLE? A.¬†Taproom Manager Q. HOW DID YOU COME UP WITH THE NAME OF YOUR BREWERY? A: During the build out, the owner always brought his dog, Jim to work with him. Jim was known as the "brew dog". We always knew we wanted to encompass our furry best friends into the brewery because there really isn't anything better than drinking beer and petting dogs! We decided on the name Pinellas Ale Works but, many just know us as 'PAW'. A place where dogs are always welcome and the beer is always flowing. Q.¬†WHAT BEER/BRANDS INSPIRED YOU IN CREATING YOUR OWN BRAND? A. There is so much amazing beer out there! A few of our favorites that sparked our interest in opening up Pinellas Ale Works are Sierra Nevada and Cigar City. Q. WHAT IS YOUR BREWERY MOST KNOWN FOR? A. We are known for our wide variety of beer. We have over 40 taps of craft beer brewed on location. Try our GABF Silver Medal Winner Milk Bone Sweet Stout or our refreshingly hazy Puppy Love New England Style IPA. Q. THE ALIENS HAVE FINALLY HAD ENOUGH, YOU GET ONE LAST ITEM FROM YOUR BREWERY'S MENU BEFORE THEY EVAPORATE EARTH. WHAT IS IT? A. Our Shrimp and Risotto Bites! Wild caught gulf shrimp, Arborio rice, breaded and fried with honey habanero aioli. So delicious! and pairs great with our 'Off The Leash' American IPA. Q. WHAT BEERS ARE IN YOUR FRIDGE RIGHT NOW? A. We've got a great selection of beers to go including our Schwarzhound Black Lager, Puppy Love NESIPA, Milk Bone Sweet Stout, Pucker Pup Blood Orange Berliner, Price's Horchata Cinnamon and Vanilla Rice Ale, Fetch Session IPA, Thrill Hill Double IPA, Sit Amber Ale, Doberman Brown Ale, Piddle Pilsner, Harold's Lager and our Off The Leash American IPA. Q. WHAT IS YOUR GUILTY PLEASURE BEER(S)? A. Stouts! We love our Chocolate Covered Raspberry Stout and our Peanut Butter Pup. Q. WHAT DID YOU DO BEFORE YOU GOT INTO BEER? A. The owner, Dennis, was big into racing Motor Cross before his start in beer. He's still races and also owns bicycle's business back in his home town of New York. We‚Äôre always on the lookout for places worth celebrating ‚Äî and people worth sharing them with.¬†Have a story to share? Professionals Making an Impact All Board of Directors Development Board Professional Board The PAWS Chicago Professional Board is a group of professionals, emerging in their careers in and around the Chicagoland area, who are passionate about saving homeless pets by way of their social and professional networks. Tasked with raising funds and awareness for PAWS Chicago‚Äôs life-saving work, Professional Board members are role models in the community and a lifeline to thousands of homeless pets. As advocates committed to PAWS Chicago‚Äôs No Kill mission, the Professional Board helps homeless animals through volunteering, fostering, planning the Board‚Äôs annual fundraising events, and engaging others to support our great organization. Raising Awareness & Providing Support Events Join the Board Meet the Professional Board Raising Awareness & Providing Support PAWS Chicago is one of the nation‚Äôs largest No Kill animal shelters, guaranteeing life to the nearly 6,000 homeless animals it rescues each year. The goal of making Chicago a No Kill city is only possible through the help of the animal-loving community, as our work is 100% reliant on the support of our community. Professional Board members are true ambassadors of PAWS Chicago and homeless animals, raising awareness by way of their social and professional networks. They serve as PAWS Chicago representatives at signature events each year by volunteering, fostering, planning the board‚Äôs annual fundraising events, and engaging others to support our great organization. In order to provide the vital support PAWS Chicago needs to continue their lifesaving programs, board members are asked to complete specific Board Requirements during each year of membership, including General, Program, Fundraising and Event Requirements. The Professional Board welcomes prospective members to any of their meetings.¬†Locations vary but all meetings start with a networking hour at 5:30pm, meeting at 6:30pm, and follows with an optional post meeting social at 7:30pm.¬†Our 2025-2026 dates are: Thursday, August 21, 2025 (deadline to RSVP is Sunday, August 17) Tuesday, September 30, 2025 (deadline to RSVP is Sunday, September 28) Thursday, November 19, 2025 (deadline to RSVP is Sunday, November 16) Wednesday, January 14, 2026 (deadline to RSVP is Sunday, January 11) Thursday, February 26, 2026 (deadline to RSVP is Sunday, February 22) Wednesday, May 6, 2026 (deadline to RSVP is Sunday, May 3) If you would like to attend a meeting as a guest, please¬†email professionalboard@pawschicago.org for more information. Back to top Events Each year, the Professional Board hosts or takes part in several PAWS Chicago fundraising events, adoption events and lifesaving programs. Check them out: Animal Magnetism (April 10, 2026) Golf O pen (June 8, 2026) Beach Party (July 17, 2025) PAWS Chicago 5K (September 13, 2025) TEAM PAWS¬†Chicago (year round) Nan & Wayne Kocourek Medical Center Days (September - April) Many more events! Back to top Join the Board The PAWS Chicago Professional Board is pleased to accept new members on an ongoing basis! Prior to joining the Professional Board, please review our annual Board Requirements . To begin the application process, download and complete the Professional Board Application . Once completed, send an email with the application and your resume and a PAWS Chicago representative will follow-up with you shortly. Prospective members are invited to upcoming meetings, social events and some volunteer opportunities. If you would like to learn more about upcoming events and be included on our guest list, please send an email to professionalboard@pawschicago.org .¬† If you have additional questions and would like to set up a time to talk with our Leadership Team members or staff lead, please email us at professionalboard@pawschicago.org .
